metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11214 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in libjpeg 9a. The get_text_rgb_row function in rdppm.c allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (Segmentation fault) via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11214` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1
libturbojpeg - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

libjpeg62 - 6b1-4ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> libjpeg-turbo is a fork of libjpeg8 mdeslaur> same fix as CVE-2016-3616 same commit as CVE-2018-11213

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1').
libjpeg6b package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6b1-4ubuntu1+esm1').
